title: bbc.reporter
author: bbc.reporter
content: It appears that this will be bitcoin's biggest storyline for 2025. This will be about how bitcoin is very much needed and required to get the advantage against America's enemies and the biggest enemies mentioned in this article are China, Russia and Iran.I am a bitcoin investor and holder very much similar to all of you in this forum. However, if you are being honest with yourselves, will this new storyline be a real occurrence for our eyes to witness? The skeptical me is thinking this might be another beginning of a bitcoin circle jerk hehehehe.China is waging a multi-decade plan to displace the United States' greatest asset: the dollar. The dollar is critical to the United States' economic and geopolitical power as the global reserve currency. Without it, our influence would weaken, and our debt would become a bigger problem. This is precisely what the Chinese Communist Party and the Kremlin want.China and Russia have shed billions of dollars worth of U.S. Treasury holdings while growing their stockpiles of gold. Our sanctions, designed to separate countries from the "Western" economic system, are no longer enough of a deterrent for those who can control financial activity within their borders and project their power outward.China sees financial technology and cryptocurrency as tools to extend its financial power and surveillance globally. The United States must respond in two ways: export our financial technology and systems worldwide and embrace bitcoin as a strategic reserve asset instead of stifling innovation.Lawmakers and politicians on both sides of the aisle, most notably President-elect Donald Trump, recognize the power of holding bitcoin on the nation’s balance sheet as a hedge against inflation. This direction would also strengthen U.S. resilience against economic challenges posed by China’s financial strategies.Read in full https://www.coindesk.com/opinion/2024/12/30/why-a-u-s-bitcoin-strategic-reserve-is-vital-to-fending-off-china

comments.author: JunaidAzizi
comments.body: In the US's dominance over the world, the dollar plays a vital role in its strength, as it is a global currency. At the same time, it has its own native currency, and through it, the US can outcompete many other states financially. However, its rivals are also seeking an alternative financial system that can challenge the US system. For that reason, they created the BRICS system, which aims to sovereignize their financial system and dedollarize that region. Additionally, they established a blockchain-based system known as BTICS Pay, which can facilitate transactions between their members. If the US moves towards cryptocurrency and strengthens its system, then China or Russia will also move towards Bitcoin adoption. Furthermore, the Beijing court has granted people the right to adopt cryptocurrency as their own asset. If both sides fall into the same system, then tensions will escalate, trade costs will increase, and a new type of financial war will take place in the near future.This is what I understand from your post and the surrounding context. Maybe I am wrong, or my post makes no sense, but I am clear about all the things. If you find any mistakes, please mark them,it will help me correct them and increase my precise knowledge.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: First of all, I think that China may be confused on their stance on cryptocurrency. I say this because of the above statement and this article that I read just the day before. China’s new forex rules require banks to tighten scrutiny on cryptocurrency trades. How can they pass these laws against cryptocurrency and still expect that it would be a tool to extend its financial power and surveillance globally? They already proposed that the digital asset is considered a threat to the country’s financial stability so it doesn't make sense. As for the U.S, they will not be too quick to make embrace bitcoin as a strategic reserve asset as written in the OP. Trump has already threatened BRICS nations with 100% tariff if they replace US dollar.  We we only find out if he'll make good his threat when we see what happens to the first country that replaces the US with gold, bitcoin or whatever currency.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I think the biggest Bitcoin storyline in 2025 is its adoption by sovereign states as a strategic reserve. The adoption race involving nations, that's it. Everything will be against the backdrop that Bitcoin is beyond the control of any power, whether its the West or the China group. But I guess the first priority of the US should be to create a FOMO effect. It should make Bitcoin coveted by every nation. It should make Bitcoin precious everywhere. Otherwise, that the US is somehow backed by Bitcoin is going to be pointless. That's worthless to China or Russia. They could choose another blockchain-based currency of their preference. The USD remains hollow. But if every country believes that Bitcoin is truly valuable, then the USD would be respected. Then China and Russia would be left with no choice but to embrace it as well.
